description: Greed & Rapacity: Loki Bound CS [DREAM001] $8.00 Top Left Ponderous and punishing, these 30+ minutes will drag you through the dark crevices between funeral doom, black metal, and dark ambient with an absolute monomania. Layers of sound decompose amid (possibly channeled) whispers, shrieks, and moans. Less than 10 copies remaining. Taste it here. Mare Cognitum: The Sea Which Has Become Known CS [DREAM002] $8.00 Top Right Progressive black metal with eyes to the stars from the concrete jungles of southern California. By turns pummeling, shimmering, and melancholy, reflecting the depths of space. Artwork and design by Aaron Metté. Edition of 100 copies. All orders include a download code for the digital edition. Taste it here. Ekadzati: Demo CS [DREAM003] $8.00 Bottom Left Noise-reinforced black metal alloyed with traces of ambient, doom, and drone. Riddling lyrics that hint at the rattling darkness of esoteric Buddhism. Over 17 minutes of killing the ego documented across two tracks. Edition of 100 copies. Each copy includes a download code for the digital edition, as well as an 11”x17” poster and a bonus PDF booklet containing additional art and a short esoteric work. TOGAL Edition is SOLD OUT. Taste it here. Serpentina: Aquelarre CS [DREAM004] $8.00 Bottom Right At long last, the first act to sign with Milam is seeing release. I hope you're sitting down, 'cause it's a weird one. Imagine if Sun Ra and Blut Aus Nord got caught in a blender operated by Mirai Kawashima. Nearly an hour of bitter, dizzying poison is on tap. Here, have a taste. description: Bleakwood/Ekadzati: Split 7" [DREAM005] $10.00 Two bands and two labels whose sole purpose is the expression of iconoclastic black art join together in a trans-Pacific partnership to present their latest aural artifact—a split 7” documenting their wanderings in the crepuscular corridors of being. Drawing from Western and Eastern esoteric traditions respectively, Bleakwood and Ekadzati apply the force of sound as a skillful means to guide and challenge the listener into liminal states and dark dreams. Their efforts move in counterpoint, nudging the listener through ravenous motion, crawling melodic stasis, dizzy rhythmic stuttering . . . Co-released with Tactical Solutions Recordings, the split is presented in a unique wingfold sleeve fastened with an obi strip which comes in one of five colors. All orders include a download code for the digital edition. Taste it here. In addition to the regular edition, there are a few test pressings available. These are simple: white label, white card sleeve. Not the painted versions that were available previously. Note: All prices include shipping within the United States. For international orders, please email before ordering for a shipping quote.

name: Distro Stock
description: Spectral Lore/Locust Leaves: Split CD $12.00 Left From the label, Order of Theta: "Clandestine and unassuming, Spectral Lore remains safely cloistered from the frustratingly blasé world of today's black metal. On this, his latest offering to date, Ayloss expands further on his experimentation with uplifting atmospherics and invites us to surrender our consciousness, if only for a while, to his musical netherworld. As epic as it is long, single song 'Kathikon' (i.e. 'duty' in Greek) both defies and re-defines the typical black metal blueprints introducing a post-rock-esque flair in its structure with a rich instrumentation. For most bands this would mean a rather embarrassing prolapse into aimless noodling but Ayloss' knack for warm, expansive guitar narratives à la Wolves in the Throne Room ensures that this makes for a very addictive listen indeed. For the second part obscure extreme metallers Locust Leaves come forth with 'Promise'. I'm sure you've never heard of them but what they lack in reputation they make up for in technical dexterity. Above everything is the song's fluidity and sheer artistic 'out-there-ness' which seamlessly flows from one thematic to the next. Far from easily digestible music, this song demands from the listener to pay full attention; in return 'Promise' offers a unique musical journey which becomes more rewarding with every listen."
